result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric R. Souza Jr.

defendant.name: Souza, Eric R., Jr.

records.addlTxt:
Court calls @ 1:44 PM/ RM 301, 22CF83 & 22CF122. Defendant Eric R. Souza Jr. not in court.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court via zoom for Eric R. Souza Jr.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin, via zoom. Court notes Def. is currently in treatment. Atty Gramstrup has not been able to get in contact with Def. State requests an Adjourned Initial Appearance for a later date. Bond remains.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court calls 22CF122 & 22CF83  @ 1:42 PM Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Eric R. Souza Jr.  Attorney Elizabeth R. Gebert in court for State of Wisconsin. All parties via zoom. Atty Gramstrup advise def is in treatment.  Court will adjourn.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 7, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Eric R. Souza Jr.
Current: 325 Sentinel Drive, Cephas House, Waukesha, WI 53189 United States  (Effective: 08-02-2022)
Prior: 1117 Edison St, Antigo, WI 54409
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:09 PM/Rm. 301/Defendant Eric R. Souza in court, in custody at Lang. Co. Jail.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eric R. Souza appeared by video means.  All parties and reporter by Zoom.  Def. is trying to contact public defender.  Def. now wants to waive right to attorney.  Court reviews Def.'s right to attorney.  Court advises Def. of charges and penalties.  Def. waives right to attorney and asks Court to allow himself to represent himself.  Court finds Def. waives right to attorney and finds Def. competent to represent himself.  Court advises Def. of right to preliminary hearing and time limits.  Def. waives time limits for preliminary.  Court accepts waiver of time limits.  Def. is on probation hold.  Status conference scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and of no possession dangerous weapon.

01:07 PM Defendant Eric R. Souza in court, in custody.  Elizabeth R. Gebert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear via Zoom.   Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights and given 3 options, PD, hire own or court appointed atty.  Def. makes statement and decides to represent himself.  DA makes cash bond recommendation of $1,500 with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances and no dangerous weapons. Defendant is on a probation hold. Def. responds.  Court makes ruling.  Court orders $1,500 cash bond with conditions of no illegal use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no possession dangerous weapons.  Waiver of Attorney and Adjourned Initial Appearance is scheduled  04/28/22 at 1:00pm.  Court is adjourned.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
